In order to be admitted to the meeting virtually (via zoom), you must identify yourself through name and/or use of the camera so that your face may be viewed.

Wear a mask at all times, including when speaking

Complete symptom check prior to entering the meeting, including temperature

Use hand sanitizer prior to entering the meeting

Sit 6 feet from others unless living in the same household

Parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles, siblings...thank you for being the teacher at home today while our CCSD educators work hard to continue learning experiences remotely! It takes a village to raise a child (love Clear Creek, best village ever!), and a team to educate fully. We are grateful for our teams of educators, parents, community and everyone who is helping kids continue learning this week!

Throughout the week it may take more creativity to keep our kids happy, healthy, and engaged. Some of the schedules our families have created are AMAZING. Share ideas!

Outside time is always good: hike, walk, find new trails.

Journal writing, letter writing, imaginative writing, story-telling, all great activities. Another idea: there are many people who are in nursing homes, elder care, assisted living who are not able to have visitors currently. Write letters, poems, stories to share with them.

Together we will learn, together we will share.

Clear Creek School District will be closed March 16-March 27. There is the possibility of a longer closure depending on recommendations from our health experts. We will keep you informed as we learn more and make necessary decisions.

Most of our students brought home needed materials yesterday. However, if you or your child needs to pick up anything from the school, we will have staff on site until 3pm today.

Look for information from your child's teachers early next week regarding distance learning. Most will share this information via an email. This will look different across grade levels.

We are currently developing a plan to provide food for those in need. In addition, Mountain Backpacks is working on a plan to distribute as well.

The purpose of closing schools is to limit interactions among people. As you consider plans for child care, please keep in mind that smaller groups are better.

We will post more information on our Clear Creek website as well as on Facebook.

Thank you for your support as we work together through this situation!
Warmly,
Karen Quanbeck

Two days of learning & great conversation at our Homegrown Talent Initiative leaders retreat. This is essential work to help us re-imagine learning experiences for our students.
Kids need opportunities to learn about future careers, to "try on" various roles in local businesses, and to wrestle with messy problems with no easy answers.

From The Age of Agility, a recent publication by America Succeeds:
"Education needs to be preparing students for jobs that don't exist and to use technologies, sciences, and methods that we haven't even discovered yet, to solve problems that we haven't identified." --Jamie Casp, Google, Education Evangelist
"We can't just go out and throw up some ads and hire some skilled people. The numbers just are not out there. High schools and colleges in the U.S. are not turning out graduates with the mix of technical expertise, soft skills, problem-solving ability and communication skills that companies like Toyota need."--Dennis Parker, Assistant Manager, Toyota North American Production Support Center

"I hope students are excited to come to school every day and the classroom is a place they feel comfortable, safe and loved"
"Transparency, vision, kids and community pride"

post_text:
So proud of our Eco School Garden Team! They seeded and dedicated the Clear Creek Eco School Cultivate Kindness Garden this week. The seeds are native wildflowers that represent kindness notes sent out last spring during the week of Day Without Hate. The beautiful sign was designed by student (master) artist Naomi Egan.

A special thanks to Lisa Pettitt and Christine Crouse for their support of this great team of students!
